content.description: High ball boulder with an iffy landing in a beautiful location. Start at the horizontal jug crack and move up and to the right to the first stinky crimp. Long reach to the flake. More stinky crimps to the top. Crimps are brittle and sharp. Don't end up in the soup.
content.location: Straight up the main face of the most obvious wall.

content.description: Wallis Sands area is always crowded during the summer months, including the parking overlook above this cliff. Parking is posted as maximum of 1 hour, but I don't know how regulated this is. During the fall and spring season you might have more luck than midsummer. Additionally, you are going to absolutely need to go on low tide or you won't be able to climb at all. Careful of the tidal pools, some spots are sketchier than others. If it's a sunny day you are going to be hot so prepare for that.
